entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 4:22PM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 7:38PM CDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Cache River Near Patterson affecting Jackson and Woodruff Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cache River Near Patterson.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 10 at 7:52AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 9 to 11 feet. * WHERE...East facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebrea, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 10 at 8:23PM MST until August 10 at 8:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHEASTERN PIMA COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 830 PM MST... The storm which prompted the warning near northwest Tucson has weakened below severe limits, and has exited the warned area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 8:03PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pinal County through 845 PM MST... At 802 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Kearny, or 13 miles west of Hayden, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 10 at 1:24PM PDT until August 10 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Strong winds aloft will gradually mix downward to all elevations this afternoon and evening, and are likely to do so again Thursday. Gusty south to southwest winds combined with low RH and recent fire starts will lead to critical fire weather conditions Wednesday afternoon and evening and Thursday afternoon and evening in south central Oregon and northeast California.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley; Siskiyou County from the Cascade Mountains East and South to Mt Shasta

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 11 at 10:28AM ChST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WETTER WEATHER POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A series of passing disturbances could bring periods of heavy rain to the above islands from Monday August 15th to Friday August 19th. Sufficient heavy rain could cause urban and small stream flooding.

entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM CDT THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 4 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Milwaukee, Racine, and Kenosha counties.
